Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Three-dimensional framework with dynamic pore apertures

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption/binding at pore aperture, does not spontaneously enter internal pore space despite inducing gate-opening distortion.

Other Information.Additional Info: Energetically prefers to reside inside the ZIF-8 pore aperture due to strong van der Waals interactions. Can be blocked by larger solvent molecules.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Enters pore via van der Waals attraction followed by repulsive force from HMIm rotation pushing water into the pore.

Other Information.Additional Info: 4-12 molecules were able to enter the pore in 2 of 6 total PL simulations, and only in CO2 containing systems. Not a free entry.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Binding at pore aperture; prevented from entering internal pore space due to larger molecular size and hydrogen bonding with other solvent molecules.

Other Information.Additional Info: Bound in the ZIF-8 pore aperture. Migration to aperture was much slower due to larger molecular size. Formed stable hydrogen-bonded clusters with water.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Binding at pore aperture; prevented from entering internal pore space due to larger molecular size.

Other Information.Additional Info: Bound in the ZIF-8 pore aperture. Migration to aperture was much slower due to larger molecular size. This is also the organic linker of the MOF.

Sieving Mechanism: Size-selective adsorption/binding and exclusion at the pore aperture, with conditional internal pore entry for smaller molecules (e.g., water) due to framework flexibility and repulsive forces.

Experimental Validation.Method: Ab initio molecular dynamics (AIMD) and Density Functional Theory (DFT) simulations

Other Information.Additional Info: Studied as a component in a Type 3 porous liquid (PL) composed of a ZIF-8 particle solvated in a water, ethylene glycol, and 2-methylimidazole solvent system. Flexible framework capable of gate-opening. Simulations revealed differences in gas diffusion compared to crystalline ZIF-8, highlighting selective surface binding over bulk absorption.
